Description: Two sections of a corroded iron knife (not joined): a large cracked blade, flat and rounded at the end; a full tang widening near the blade, with a line of five rivets for the handle scales, which were made of wood, as shown by many traces in the corrosion.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 77 § 77, pl. xxxvii, 20 : "The knife (fig.20) may be perhaps for civil uses; the handle shows well the grain of the wood, which was fastened on by five rivets of iron".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 77 § 77, p. 110, pl. xxxvii, 20)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.46, p.74, p.184, pl.26)
Condition: Corroded; blade broken in three fragments rejoined; tang broken in three fragments, rejoined.
